headline: Smothered Filet Mignon
description: The filet mignon marinates in a mixture of balsamic vinegar and Dijon mustard while you are heating the grill and cooking the onions, and can be made in under an hour. Serve with some mashed garlic red potatoes and sweetened green beans for a fabulous special occasion meal.

video.description: Scrumptious and smothered, put this tasty dish on your menu for the week!
video.name: Smothered Filet Mignon

name: Smothered Filet Mignon

recipeInstructions.text: Season steaks with seasoned salt and black pepper, and arrange in a single layer in a large baking dish. In a bowl, whisk together olive oil, balsamic vinegar, mustard, and rosemary. Pour mixture over filets, and turn to coat. Marinate for up to 30 minutes.
While you are marinating the meat, melt the butter in a skillet over medium heat. Cook onion slices in butter until soft, then stir in sugar. Continue cooking until onions are caramelized. Set aside.
Preheat grill for high heat on one side, and medium heat on the other side.

Lightly oil the grill grate. Place steaks on the hot side of the grill, and cook for 10 minutes, turning once. When the steaks are almost done, move to the cooler side of the grill. Top each filet with a quarter of the caramelized onions and blue cheese. Close the lid, and continue cooking until the cheese is melted.

review.reviewBody: This is my favorite, go-to, melt in your mouth, steak recipe. When I need a special dinner or when I'm just craving a delicious steak, this is where I turn. Thank you so much for making all my senses POP!
Delicious!

Followed the recipe, 4ish minutes per side on a 450* grill. Then off heat for the onions and blue cheese, hubby was blown away! I did add extra butter to the onions just because.....will have to make this again!! Thank you for sharing!
No changes. Husband liked it alot.
I thought the marinade was very good and the onions and blue cheese topped it off beautifully. I broiled my steaks instead of grilling.

Made this many years ago for a big Mother’s Day dinner party along with grilled lobsters. Huge hit! Totally forgot about this recipe until my husband reminded me yesterday. Smaller group with stay at home orders but still sure to be a hit.
Love this recipe! It looks difficult and fancy but is secretly easy to throw together. And delicious! The only change I made was swapping brown sugar for the white.
I made it for dinner this evening and it was fantastic! A nice additional recipe to have available, especially for guests. Great flavors that mix nicely and make for a wonderful presentation.
Simply amazing!! I’ll definitely be adding this recipe to my collection!
I made this for my daughter and son in law and they loved it!
Delicious combination of tangy and sweetness.
I omitted the cheese. Too rich!
I used a little sharp cheese and parmesena cheese instead of the blue cheese. WE have made this several times and love it!!!
Made it twice! Great recipe! Perfect for me a novice cook to make!
Wow! Very impressed with this. Easy recipe and tasty to the very last bite. I will definitely make this again, and I don't hesitate to recommend it to others.

My normal filet marinade takes 24 hours, so when we decided at the last minute to make some filets we had in the freezer, I was on the hunt for something that didn't need that long and turned to this recipe, given all the great reviews. For starters, the marinade smelled and tasted fantastic!! I was extremely excited about how my steak would taste, simply based on the marinade. It was also super quick to whip up with ingredients I had on hand. 5-stars for that. The only reason I'm rating it lower than 5 stars is because I definitely disagree with the 30 minute marinade time. We gave it about 45 mins (again, this was a last minute dinner idea so we were pressed for time), which was no where near long enough. =( The steaks barely picked up the flavoring of the marinade and because of that, tasted pretty bland. We'll definitely be trying it again - but only when we have several hours (or overnight) to marinate.

I absolutely detest blue cheese but the recipes ingredients were to alluring. I used the ingredients according to the recipe on allrecipes.com, and I'm glad I did! One of the best steaks I've ever had or made. Thank you for making this recipe accessible on the web!
Probably the best filet I've ever made. It was extremely tender and very tasty. The recipe is a keeper.
They sure look awesome! Only thing I did not add is blue cheese. Mmmm yummy looking! Yummy tasting! Great recipe!
Great flavor on the steak but blue cheese crumbles did not melt! Would have had to cook steaks too long to get it to melt. Disappointed!

Replaced white sugar brown sugar. Caramelizing was enhanced richly, to me. Didn't serve wine, but meal was delicious. Also tweaked the recipe's marinade. "Delish dish, simple and not time consuming at all!"

Made it for my wife and mother-in-law for Mothers Day. Everyone absolutely loved it. My wife said to make sure I use the marinade the next time I grill steaks again. Thanks again for making me look like I know what I'm doing
Hit all around! Total yum and easy!
My husband made this for Valentines's Day... It was absolutely the best steak I have ever eaten!

The marinade was delicious. However I seared the meat on both sides for two minutes each on a cast iron grill pan then finished in a 400 deg oven for 8 minutes for a perfect medium rare. My husband loved it. I also didn't cook the onion just because we don't like onion. Enjoy!
My boyfriend and I loved this recipe! It was fast and easy, we used goat cheese which was good but next time we are going to try the blue cheese.

This was amazing - made it last night and both me and my boyfriend loved it! A definite keeper and my new favorite way of preparing tenderloin filets. I made it exactly as written with one exception; I cooked the filets in a cast iron skillet instead of on the grill (with temps of -10 it's a bit too cold to be doing anything on the grill right now). Absolutely delicious. We tried it with and without the blue cheese - great both ways. Thank you to JDVMD for sharing the recipe. Yum!!
Sauce needed my zip so I added some rice vinegar.

Fantastic recipe! I am not a steak eater, but once a year will eat a filet. This was our first attempt at grilling them at home. My husband did a great job with the grilling of the steaks. The instruction/heat time was perfect for a medium-rare steak. The flavor was outstanding, and the bleu cheese was a perfect topping. Served these with 'Grilled Rock Lobster Tails', 'Grilled Sweet Onion' both from AR and grilled Parmesan green beans. Definitely a 5-star meal tonight.

I didn't have Rosemary or Blue Cheese and somehow managed to forget the sugar and onions (duh), but it still was absolutely FANTASTIC!!! This will be the only way I cook a filet from now on. Oh, I also didn't have
Dijon, so I just used another spicy mustard I had.
Delicious favors!! Definitely a keeper!; My husband loved it!!

Let me start by saying I don't really care for steak, so covering it in cheese and other goodness was sort of a brilliant idea to me. I couldn't find filet mignon at our commissary anywhere so I went with 4 strip steaks and they worked fine. Everyone really loved this. Except me. I mean the toppings were tasty and all but the steak still tasted just like... well, steak. I didn't think the marinade did much for it. On the upside, I left two of the steaks in the marinade overnight and cooked them today, sliced thin and had steak salad for lunch. That was superb. I might make again.

What a wonderful balance, I didn't Have Dijon, rather a Spicy Brown Mustard, nor did I have blue cheese, so I just smothered the filet in the caramelized onions. The dish turned out perfect. I had a nice bottle of Affentaler Valley of the Monkey Baden Pinot Nior to match the meal. Thanks for the excellent posting.

Excellent! So easy to make and very flavorful. The balsamic marinade is excellent. I used dijon and will again. I also used sweet onions and omitted the sugar, there is no need for it. My husband loved it. A keeper!
This recipe is great when you cannot afford a fillet mignon this will also work well with a london broil and chicken breast if you want to change it up.
This recipe is great when you cannot afford a fillet mignon this will also work well with a london broil and chicken breast if you want to change it up.

I used coarse ground mustard in lieu of plain dijon mustard (it was what I had on hand) and omitted the onions out of personal preference, but the marinade was delicious. Very simple and easy to make.
Loved it!!!!!
This was okay.

This was wonderful, the caramelized onions and the blue cheese on top of the steak made it go from ordinary to something special. I followed the recipe that was here and did not make any changes at all.
I made this for NYE 2012 with a roasted vegetable recipe also on here. My husband and I stayed in while 3 year old slept and this felt very festive. It was great. Recommend for special event at home.
I was out of blue cheese but made it with the rest and it was one of the most savory pieces of meat I've ever enjoyed.

Very good. My husband cooked it into and excellent medium well tenderness. The marinade was excellent. we used chedder cheese as I didn't have blue cheese. We also cooked this on a pan over the stove. Thank you!
just made this for my and we both agree that it was the best steak we have ever tasted
Yumm...this recipe is great as is. Enjoy!

This was out of sight delicious! I marinated the filets about 90 minutes and when they were almost done on the grill, I put them in the pan that I carmelized the onions in, topped them with the onions and cheese and put the lid on till the cheese melted. I didn't want to lose any of that good blue cheese in the grill. The combination of the onions and blue cheese on the steak is awesome.

Made these for a special anniversary dinner party and they were amazing! The flavor the marinade added was subtle, and didn't take away from the premium cut of a filet. I Carmelized the onions a couple hours ahead of time, which I would recommend as they take quite a while. The flavor they add is well worth the time . I substituted Feta for the blue cheese, just a taste preference, but it turned out really good as well.
I made this last night for my family and they died because it was so amazing! They are making me make it again for them tonight! Definitely a new favorite :D Try it!!

This was delicious. I followed the recipe as written except I reduced the sugar slightly and didnt bother with one side of the grill being hotter than the other. Someone complained about the blue cheese - saying it overwhlemed the meat - please don't skimp on the blue cheese!!! The blue cheese, along with the yummy marinade, makes the recipe! If we didn't want a blue cheese taste we would not have selected this recipe! Glad I made this for our anniversary dinner...Can't wait to make again soon!

I made this a few nights ago for our Valentine’s Day dinner along with potatoes and roasted asparagus. I was surprised by the short marinating time, but followed the recipe. I caramelized the onions earlier in the day and zapped them in the microwave just before topping the grilled filets. Rather than try to top the steaks while standing over a searing grill, we brought them inside, topped them with the onions and blue cheese and popped them under the broiler just until the cheese began to melt. Hubs and I both like our filets and we really enjoyed the caramelized onions on this. But we both agreed the blue cheese overwhelmed all the other flavors, even though I skimped on it a bit. For us the blue cheese was about all we could taste. So our conclusion is that we’ll definitely make this again, but skip the blue cheese entirely. I guess it’s just not for us. I do think, however, a balsamic glaze drizzled over the onions/steaks would be fabulous!
The marinade was AWESOME! The steaks were tender and juicy. I will use this again and again.
The marinade was AWESOME! The steaks were tender and juicy. I will use this again and again.

Delicious! We used this on a couple of sirloin steaks and it was fantastic. I didn't have dijon mustard so I just mixed Hot and Sweet with Coarse Brown, turned out great! The onions are terrific! Add blue cheese a little at a time, because a little goes a long way on this steak! No leftovers, everyone cleaned their plates!
I used red wine vinegar instead of balsamic. I broiled the steaks in the oven instead of grilling. They turned out great!
One word: AMAZING. I broiled the steak, and the flavor was to die for. Will make again soon!!!!
Amazing. The balance of sweet and salty between the onions and blue cheese is perfect. We will make this again and again!
A little too sweet for me. If I try again, I'd cut the sugar by at least half.

AWESOME! After I trimmed the filet, I marinated in a large ziplock, with all of the air squeezed out. Do NOT marinate for longer than 30 minutes. You would think that filet mignon would not absorb a lot of marinade because it is so moist but it does. The only changes I made were to cut the sugar in half and use brown sugar instead of white and I used gorgonzola because that was what I had. Fantastic!
This was amazing!

I used goat cheese (AMAZING) as it was what was in my fridge and I didn't feel like doing groceries... and I added a red wine reduction, def. not needed as this cut is so juicy but it definitely complimented it fantastically. 
Best meal I've ever made... maybe even ever eaten..

My husband called this FABULOUS! All the flavors work well together- balsamic vinegar, blue cheese, carmelized onions. We loved it! I marinated for a little over an hour but followed the rest of the recipe as written.
Very good. I substituted feta for the bleu cheese only because that is what I had on hand. It was excellent with the feta.
Outstanding

Oh my!! YUM! I actually marinated this overnight because my hubby got called into work when I was planning on grilling it. Thank goodness... the flavor was superb!! I will definately be making this again and again and I will always marinate it overnight.

I have made this recipe now 4 times and each time I say it's the best steak I've ever had. Now...I don't go buy the $90 steak at the steakhouse, but I'm not shy about ordering a good piece of meat from a top steakhouse and if you get a good cut of meat from a butcher then it will top just about anything.

This recipe was awesome! Loved the blue cheese. Altered the marinade - used actual dijon mustard and red cooking wine in place of the balsamic. It was great! Also cooked up some bacon and crumbled on top with the onion and and blue cheese. It was delicious!
This recipe is AMAZING! We make it again and again. The only change is we use venison steaks, and that works just great.
OUTSTANDING !!!

Outstanding! My wife and I made this for Valentine's Day and it was scrumdiddlyupmtious!!!

Definitely recommend to any meat lover!

Excellent! I made this for Valentines dinner last night, and now I wish I'd made an extra steak for later. I didn't have any blue cheese, but the marinade and carmelized onion were full of flavor on their own. I did use about 2 tablespoons of the leftover marinade in the onions, and reduced it before adding the sugar. I was able to cut out the butter by using the olive oil in the marinade instead. Can't wait for an excuse to make this again!
I didn't care for the taste that the marinade gave my filets...was disappointing, especially after reading all the good reviews. As always, thanks for sharing but I won't make this again.
Made this for New Years eve. Used regular dijon since it was all I had. Fantastic!
Wow, simple yet fancy looking and the taste is phenomenal! I'm not a fan of steak in the least, but this was fantastic. My fiance licked the plate clean :)

These were outstanding!!! I marinated my steaks overnight and was afraid I'd ruined them but was fortunate--the balsamic vinegar was good quality, so it was almost like wine. The real irony here is I'm typically vegetarian, but had a real craving for a good steak. This was it!!

We used a different marinade (bottled 'red wine and cracked pepper' by Diana) but overall I wasn't impressed. We did cook this in a grill pan to achieve a nice 'crossed' sear. The amount of blue cheese and the caramelized onions seemed too much for such a delicate cut of meat. It was eaten and enjoyed by our guests, but it won't be a repeat.
this was amazing. one of the best meals I ever made
Wonderful flavor. Made as is.
Delicious! We don't have an actual grill so we used our foreman to cook the steaks and transferred to an oven to broil to melt the cheese. Turned out great!
Hands down amazing.

The only changes I made were 1) r/f gorgonzola instead of blue cheese, a little less; 2) regular Dijon instead of course grainy dijon; smart balance instead of butter; cooked as directed but used indoor grill pan on high heat, 3-4 mins per side for med-rare. This has potential to be 5 stars if I correct my technique. Would prob cook on outdoor grill next time. . . smoked out my house and steak is just so good on grill! Would cook a little longer at med-high instead. The marinade and caramelized onions made this. . . great dish! Thanks!
Great recipe! We used our George Foreman grill with it in the open position. Next time we will try with either Mozzarella, goat or Feta cheese.
This was a good recipe although I feel like the combination of flavors really took away from the flavor of the meat itself.
This was great! The sweet flavor of the caramelized onions balances out terrifically with the savory tartness of the blue cheese.
The filet had a wonderful flavor. The onions & blue cheese were a great addition. It's definitely a keeper.

My husband loved this recipe as written. I preferred it without the toppings (onions and cheese) in the end... It was easy enough for me to just scrape them off and enjoy the flavor of the marinated steak. We will definitely be making this again.
Very good. Only changes: eliminated sugar and butter...and added a bit more olive oil to make it healthier. Taste did not suffer at all.

I am not an accomplished chef with steak, but with the directions here, the steak turned out amazing! We used sirloin and still had great results. If you are not a blue cheese fan, feta also works well. The directions on how to cook the steak made all the difference for me. We just made this for friends and it was a big hit

Not for me! Caramelized onions add a lot of sweetness to a premium cut of meat which does not require or want sweetness. I will stay with a basic filet mignon or maybe some slightly Asian flavor but not a sweet flavor. Thanks for trying.

Oh my! This was amazing. I had bought Piedmontese filets and was worried about trying something new with such an expensive cut. I don't think I've ever received so many compliments! Be sure to grill these, don't sear!!! I always buy Benissimo Basil & Dried Tomato Olive Oil (actually dipping oil) to use in some receipes so I used it instead of adding the herbs. Amazing! I offered blue cheese and goat cheese. Thanks so much, I will definitely make this many times this summer!UPDATE: Less than a week later, I used the marinade on some steak/onion kabobs on the grill, then sprinkled with blue cheese crumbles when done. Not exactly the same but at was wonderful as well!
dinner party w/steak & fish, & the steak lovers were thrilled w/their selection. Flavorful, & tender this steak was easy to prepare, looked great on the plate & there were no leftovers to be found.
very good.
I added bacon crumbles for a little more flavor... excellent.

This was delicious! I made this for my husband and I for Valentines day...we were both saying mmm mmm good! I left the blue cheese off and pan fried in my cast iron skillet and then put in my broiler for about 10 minutes. It was absolutely great! A wonderful way to end our Valentines day.

Was delicious! I cooked it for my family and I hardely EVER cook, so they were already a little uneasy leaving dinner up to me..My dad can be hard to please, but he and the rest of the family loved it. Was easy to follow and cook. We've made it again since.

Was delicious! I cooked it for my family and I hardely EVER cook, so they were already a little uneasy leaving dinner up to me..My dad can be hard to please, but he and the rest of the family loved it. Was easy to follow and cook. We've made it again since.
Best steak I have ever eaten/made! Oh soooo.....yummy! Can't wait to make it again.
I thought it was very tasty. My meat lover husband not so much. But then again he prefers his steak plain with just a little salt and pepper.

I am reviewing the marinade only, as we used a cream sauce with onion and blue cheese for the topping instead (from the tasty kitchen site...very good, by the way). The marinade did impart some sweetness to the filets (my boyfriend commented on the sweetness immediately with the first bite), but other than that, I didn't think it did anything for the steaks in terms of flavor. Also, for those who are planning on searing the steaks indoors, take note: the balsamic vinegar caused problems when I went to pan-sear the steaks. I patted the steaks dry, removing as much moisture as possible from the marinade, and used Mark Bittman's technique for searing that requires less heat than normal (a method I have used over and over again with great success and zero smoke). The balsamic vinegar burned almost immediately, even on moderate heat, filling the kitchen with particularly acrid smoke. While the steaks were cooked to a lovely medium rare, the burnt balsamic black crust was a detraction. That being said, I think the onion-blue cheese combo is a nice touch, and our cream sauce used similar flavors - all I did differently was add cream to the onions after they were caramelized, reduced that by about half, and then melted some blue cheese into the sauce - a nice option if you want a milder blue cheese flavor.
Delicious! Definitely let FM sit out for 1/2 hour...yum!
